benchmark_details.name: UCFE (User-Centric Financial Expertise)
benchmark_details.overview: The UCFE benchmark is designed to evaluate the ability of large language models (LLMs) to handle complex real-world financial tasks through user-centric interactions and expert evaluations.
benchmark_details.data_type: multi-round dialogue interactions involving financial tasks

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a rigorous framework for assessing LLM performance in complex financial scenarios based on user interactions.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark may not fully capture all real-world financial applications due to task coverage limitations.

data.source: Collected user interaction data and financial task scenarios based on user surveys.
data.size: 330 data points encompassing various user intents and financial tasks.
data.annotation: Data collected through user surveys and expert evaluations.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using user preferences alignment and performance comparisons via Elo rating system.
methodology.interpretation: A higher Pearson correlation indicates alignment with human preferences; Elo scores rank model performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Model benchmarks exhibited a Pearson correlation of 0.78 in alignment with human evaluations.
methodology.validation: Validated using multiple LLM evaluators to assess the robustness of results.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis included diverse user groups reflecting different financial expertise levels.
targeted_risks.harm: The framework aims to minimize biases and ensure equitable model performance across user demographics.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User data collected followed ethical guidelines with no harmful outcomes expected.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Informed consent obtained from all survey participants.
